title: Can You See Who Saved Your Tiktok Videos?

steps.title: TikTok does not allow you to view who saved your videos.
steps.content: TikTok does not allow you to view who saved your videos. There is no way to check and see who has downloaded your videos. You can, however, see who liked or bookmarked your video . If you are worried about other people saving your videos, you can disable video downloads to prevent people from downloading them.

steps.title: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Tap the TikTok icon on your Home screen or Apps menu to open TikTok.

steps.title: Tap Inbox.
steps.content: Tap Inbox . It's the fourth button at the bottom of the screen to the right of the "+" button. It has an icon that resembles a speech bubble.

steps.title: Tap Activities.
steps.content: Tap Activities . It's at the top of your Inbox. This displays the All Activity page.

steps.title: Tap View all.
steps.content: Tap View all . It's below your most recent notifications at the top of the page. This displays all your notifications.

steps.title: Scroll through to see who has liked or added your video to their favorites.
steps.content: Scroll through to see who has liked or added your video to their favorites. You will be able to see the notifications for all who have liked or added your videos to their favorites. If more than one user has liked or added a video to their favorites, tap others at the end of the notification to see a complete list of users who have liked or added the video to their favorites. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Tap the TikTok icon on your Home screen or Apps menu to open TikTok.

steps.title: Tap your profile.
steps.content: Tap your profile. It's the button with an icon that resembles a person in the lower-right corner. This opens the Profile menu.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's the icon with three horizontal lines in the upper-right corner. This displays a pop-up menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings and privacy . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear. It's at the bottom of the pop-up menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy . It's the second option in the "Settings and Privacy" menu. It's next to an icon that resembles a lock. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Downloads.
steps.content: Tap Downloads . It's towards the bottom of the "Privacy" menu. It's next to an icon that resembles an arrow pointing down over a line. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to "Video Downloads."
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to "Video Downloads." This turns video downloads on or off. When video downloads are off, users will not be able to download your videos through the Share menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open TikTok on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Tap the TikTok icon on your Home screen or Apps menu to open TikTok.

steps.title: Find a video you want to save.
steps.content: Find a video you want to save. You can save any video as long as the creator allows their content to be downloaded. You can save any video on your For You page, or someone you follow. You can also download a video that you have liked or added to your favorites . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the icon that resembles an arrow pointing right.
steps.content: Tap the icon that resembles an arrow pointing right. It's the button at the bottom on the right side of the screen just above the record icon. This opens the Share menu. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save video.
steps.content: Tap Save video . It's one of the bottoms at the bottom of the Share menu. This saves the video to the Gallery on Android, or your Camera Roll on iPhone and iPad. [9] X Research source
